jurisdictions.name: City of Los Angeles

rent_control.applies_to: Multi-family buildings built on or before October 1, 1978
rent_control.formula_update: Rent formula changes approved around Feb 2, 2026; verify CPI-based formula details via official LAHD/City ordinance materials. LAHD states allowable increase remains 3% for Jul 1, 2025-Jun 30, 2027.

just_cause.applies_to: All residential units via JCO (after 6 months or end of initial lease)
just_cause.filing_requirement: Eviction notices must be filed with LAHD within 3 business days of service

key_rights: RSO: 3% annual rent cap (July 2025 - June 2027)
Utility adders eliminated February 2, 2026
JCO: Just-cause eviction required for ALL units after 6 months
No-fault evictions require relocation assistance
Eviction notices must be filed with LAHD within 3 business days
Right to Counsel program for eligible tenants
Tenant Anti-Harassment Ordinance (TAHO) protections

relocation_assistance.amounts: See LAHD Relocation Assistance Bulletin for current amounts
relocation_assistance.qualified_definition: Age 62+, disabled, or has minor children
relocation_assistance.mom_pop_reduced: Applies to landlords with ≤4 units + 1 SFD

jurisdictions.check_coverage: Use ZIMAS at zimas.lacity.org or call LAHD hotline

jurisdictions.name: LA County Unincorporated Areas

rent_control.applies_to: Properties with 2+ units, Certificate of Occupancy on/before February 1, 1995
rent_control.current_cap: See DCBA rent increase bulletin (60% of CPI, max 3%)

just_cause.fmr_protection: For nonpayment cases under RSTPO, tenancy may be terminated only when past-due rent exceeds one month of the Fair Market Rent (FMR) threshold (see DCBA)

key_rights: Rent increases limited by RSTPO formula (60% of CPI, max 3%)
Small landlords may qualify for +1% (self-certification required)
Just-cause eviction protections required
FMR protection: Nonpayment eviction only if past-due rent exceeds 1 month FMR
Relocation assistance for no-fault evictions
Right to Counsel program for eligible tenants

relocation_assistance.amounts: Based on unit size, tenancy length, and income - see DCBA

jurisdictions.name: City of Long Beach
jurisdictions.legal_regime: AB 1482 (State) + Local Just Cause + Relocation Ordinance

rent_control.applies_to: AB 1482 covered units (15+ years old, not exempt SFH/condos)
rent_control.local_cap: No separate local rent control ordinance

just_cause.applies_to: All covered units after 12 months tenancy
just_cause.local_ordinance: Long Beach Just Cause Termination Ordinance (Mun. Code § 8.99)

key_rights: State rent cap: 5% + CPI annually (max 10%)
Local just-cause eviction protections
Relocation assistance for rent increases over 10% or no-fault evictions
Tenant harassment ordinance protections (Mun. Code § 8.101)

relocation_assistance.amount: See Long Beach Housing Authority for current amounts
relocation_assistance.applies_to: Buildings with 5+ units built before February 1, 1985

jurisdictions.name: City of Glendale

rent_control.applies_to: AB 1482 covered units only (no local rent control)
rent_control.local_trigger: Rent increases over 7% trigger relocation assistance

just_cause.local_ordinance: Just Cause and Retaliatory Eviction Ordinance (Mun. Code § 9.30)

key_rights: State rent cap: 5% + CPI annually (max 10%)
Local: Rent increase over 7% triggers relocation assistance
Right to Lease: Must be offered 1-year written lease (5+ unit buildings)
Just-cause eviction required for 3+ unit buildings
Anti-retaliation protections

triggers: Tenant vacates due to rent increase over 7%
relocation_assistance.applies_to: Buildings with 3+ units, COO before February 1, 1995

jurisdictions.name: City of Pasadena
jurisdictions.legal_regime: Pasadena Fair & Equitable Housing Charter Amendment (Measure H)
key_rights: Rent cap: 2.25% annually (Oct 2025 - Sept 2026)
Just-cause eviction protections for most units
Relocation assistance for no-fault evictions
Right to return after temporary displacement for repairs
One-for-one roommate replacement allowed
No banking of unused rent increases

relocation_assistance.amount: Based on Pasadena Fair Market Rent calculation - see city

jurisdictions.name: California Statewide (AB 1482)

rent_control.applies_to: Units 15+ years old, not covered by stricter local law

key_rights: Rent cap: 5% + regional CPI annually (max 10%)
Just-cause eviction after 12 months tenancy
Relocation assistance: 1 month rent for no-fault evictions
Written notice of exemption required if property exempt

metadata.verification_note: This dataset includes both verified items (linked) and variable items that must be checked in official bulletins at time of use
metadata.disclaimer: ⚠️ NOT LEGAL ADVICE. Laws change frequently. Always verify current rules with official sources or consult an attorney. This data is for educational purposes only.
unverified_or_variable: Specific dollar amounts for relocation (change annually July 1)
LA County RSTPO exact percentage (verify with DCBA bulletin)
